result.execSummary:
The defendant Derrick Ramon Robinson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Derrick Ramon Robinson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Derrick Ramon Robinson was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
With release privileges for treatment and work.
Consecutive to: case 12CM6408

Court orders defendant is to be assigned to the Mental Health Unit.
Concurrent with: with probation orders in case 12CM6408

miscConds.notes: Comply with the standard rules of probation/extended supervision. Defendant is to take all legally prescribed medications.
Cooperate and participate with a mental health evalution and follow any recommended treatment.
Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment. Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.

Pay DNA surcharge - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Pay the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derrick Ramon Robinson

records.addlTxt:
DOC notice of case status change.
Probation/Extended Supervision status:  
( X ) Revoked             (  ) Discharged
(  ) Discharge Certificate Filed.
Effective date:  02-19-2015            Initials:  AAC

Defendant Derrick Ramon Robinson in court with attorney Melissa J. Fitzsimmons.  Defendant Derrick Ramon Robinson in custody.  Joanne L. Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 2:    Sentencing proceeds.  Statements made by the state, defense counsel and defendant. 

Defendant sentenced to serve 9 MONTHS at the HOUSE OF CORRECTION, consecutive to case# 12CM6408, with release privileges for treatment and work. Credit for 127 days time served. 

COURT STAYS sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for a period of 2 YEARS under the supervision of Wisconsing Department of Corrections.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION (to run concurrent with probation orders in case# 12CM6408): 
* Comply with the standard rules of probation/extended supervision.
* Cooperate and participate with a mental health evalution and follow any recommended treatment.
* Defendant is to take all legally prescribed medications.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety and submit to random urine screens.
* PAY DNA surcharge - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* Defendant is to be assigned to the mental health unit.

Appeal rights given. 

FILED, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
FILED, Pretrial Incarceration Credit form.

Defendant Derrick Ramon Robinson in court with Attorney Schuyler Bogia under the student practice rule; Attorney Melissa J Fitzsimmons supervising.  Defendant Derrick Ramon Robinson IN CUSTODY.  Timothy J Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

This matter was originally scheduled for a Final Pretrial Conference today, however, the parties have now reached an agreement.

AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

**Upon State's motion and pursuant to negotiations, Court ordered Count 1 dismissed outright.

Parties request to adjourn the sentencing phase.
Court GRANTS request.
Case adjourned to 07-29-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Sentencing Hearing.

Court CANCELLED the Jury Trial date scheduled on 08-18-2014 at 8:30 AM before Judge Donald's Court.

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.
Notice of Motion and Motion To Suppress received and filed with court.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FROM THE HOUSE OF CORRECTION FOR PURPOSES OF THE SPEEDY JURY TRIAL AND FINAL PRETRIAL IN BRANCH 2.

Defendant Derrick Ramon Robinson in court (bull pen) with attorney Melissa J Fitzsimmons.  Defendant Derrick Ramon Robinson in custody.  Timothy J Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Speedy trial demand. Case adjourned for a Speedy Jury Trial and Final Pretrial in Branch 2. Agreed Upon Request For a New Court Date received and filed with court.  Jury trial scheduled for August 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Derrick Ramon Robinson appeared in person.  Attorney for defendant, Melissa Fitzsimmons appeared TELEPHONICALLY.  Timothy J Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request another scheduling conference date.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 05-21-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Scheduling Conference.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING  commencing APRIL 15, 2014 received and filed. (13 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to  Melissa Fitzsimmons - SPD

Defendant Derrick Ramon Robinson in court with attorney Melissa J Fitzsimmons.  Defendant Derrick Ramon Robinson in custody.  Timothy J Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Scott Wieting-MPD Officer.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.

COURT ORDERS BAIL AMENDED TO $500 CASH.
Same terms and conditions to remain the same.

Defendant Derrick Ramon Robinson in court with attorney Melissa J. Fitzsimmons.  Defendant Derrick Ramon Robinson in custody.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State informs the Court that the officer is not available for today's proceedings and is requesting an adjournment.  Court ordered case adjourned for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring (24 HOUR CURFEW).

ADDRESS INFO for Derrick Ramon Robinson
Current: 5238 N 84TH ST, Milwaukee, WI 53225   (Effective: 03-27-2014)
Prior: 2133 N. 41st Street, Milwaukee, WI 53208

Defendant Derrick Ramon Robinson in court with attorney Melissa J. Fitzsimmons.  Defendant Derrick Ramon Robinson in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant pled not guilty TO MISDEMEANOR COUNT 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge DONALD, Branch 2.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
